content.description: Start in an opening between the two large boulders.  Climb up into a massive undercling to clip #1.  Climb up from there into a smaller undercling and pull over a small roof (tricky).  Up again and over yet another small roof.
content.location: Middle of Brown Corridor.  Start between the two large boulders.

content.description:
This is the second bolt line from the right, on the less than vertical slab before the overhanging wall.  Troy Mayr's "Southern California Sport Climbing" guide gives this climb no stars, and it doesn't deserve any, if you're looking for the 5.8 face climb it's supposed to be.  Everyone I've talked with assures me that this climb follows the bolt line and not the crack system five or so feet to the right (which feels maybe 5.8) but everyone agrees it's "pretty hard" for a 5.8.  I'll say.  The move off the ground is harder than 5.8 and the crux, passing just left of the first bolt, is a balancy move on tiny crimps with little for the feet.  Move left to the arete to pass the second bolt and conquer the secondary crux: another dicey move on dime edges.  From there, pump through the fractured patina, passing one more bolt, to the ledge below the anchor.  A great climb if you look at it as a 5.10 crimp fest.

Kudos to the FA team; they must be real stout climbers, that this lead was so easy for them they rated it 5.8!  And this isn't another

Pinched Rib

, where the breaking of one bomber hold could dramatically increase the difficulty level.  I felt Sensible Shoes was as hard as any .10c in the area; not a lead for the 5.8 climber.  Rappel to descend.
Face climbing past four bolts, with the crux at the third.
content.protection: Four bolts to two bolt anchor.
content.location: To the right of Le Femme Fatal

content.description: A very good route with some excellent lieback moves to good footholds up the left arete, then a final sequence of knobby steep stuff to the anchors. The best easy route in the area - and IMHO an area classic.
content.protection: Three bolts to two bolt anchor.

content.description:
This climb has considerable character packed into its short length.

Disconcerting moves up steep and undulating rock lead to a headwall of sorts, from here step left and use crimper flakes to move right and up past the steepness to big jugs, a final tricky  move leads left to a big right facing flake and the anchor.
content.protection: Four bolts to two bolt anchor.
content.location: Left route on pillar left of the Sensible Shoes pillar.

climbs.name: Grain Dance
climbs.fa: First lead: Reed Ames, Emily Worby - October 2018

content.description: Climb up a thin slab face past 3 bolts. Good edges past the last bolt lead up and left to the anchor.
content.protection: 3 bolts, shares a chain anchor with the route to the left.
content.location: Starts 10 feet right of Mojave Green Arete. Currently the right-most route at The Brown Corridor.

content.description: Awkward start at the base of the large, left angled crack/flare. Clip #2 and climb up an awkward crimp and pinch move to a tough sequence of small flakes to get #3. The climbing eases slightly from there.
Start up World Full of Hate and, after a 5.11c move, clip the second bolt but make a cruxy (5.11c) traverse right from there, then up overhanging rock past four more bolts.
content.location: "Main" wall left of the easier routes - right bolt line, shared start.
